reinforcement:
⚠️ SPACE OPTIMIZED — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: ALL furniture (Bed, Sofa, Table, everything) MUST be pushed flat against walls. Nothing floating.
- CRITICAL: The physical center of the room must be COMPLETELY EMPTY floor space. No furniture, no rugs in the middle.
- Sofa along a long wall, never floating.
- Table/Desk against a wall, preferably near window if available.
- Wide clear walking path from door to all zones.
- NO furniture within 3 feet of the door.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.
exclusion_zones:

  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - kitchen counter (kitchen_counter_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
full_prompt:
TASK: Edit this 2D top-down floor plan to show the "Space Optimized" arrangement.

╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║  ⚠️  STRICT RULES                                            ║
╠══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╣
║  1. Exactly 13 movable items must appear.           ║
║  2. REQUIRED: [table, chair, chair, sofa, artwork, bed, nightstand, nightstand, plant, lamp, artwork, rug, rug]                             ║
║  3. DO NOT ADD or REMOVE any furniture.                      ║
║  4. DOOR (north (top) at ~46%): 2+ feet clear.               ║
║  5. DO NOT MOVE: [refrigerator, cabinet, kitchen counter, sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]                             ║
║  6. OUTPUT = 2D TOP-DOWN VIEW (not 3D).                      ║
╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

⚠️ DO NOT DUPLICATE FURNITURE:
- This room has exactly: 1 table, 2 chairs, 1 sofa, 2 artworks, 1 bed, 2 nightstands, 1 plant, 1 lamp, 2 rugs.
- MOVE = ERASE from old spot + PLACE in new spot. Do NOT copy.
- If the same item appears in TWO places, the output is INVALID.
- COUNT each furniture type before finishing. Counts must match input.

⚠️ EXCLUSION ZONES — furniture MUST NOT overlap these fixed fixtures:
  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - kitchen counter (kitchen_counter_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.

STYLE: Space Optimized
This space-optimized layout places all furniture against the perimeter walls to maximize the central open floor space. This creates clear, wide pathways and distinct functional zones for sleeping, living, and dining, making the studio feel larger and more organized. The arrangement ensures every piece has a dedicated spot without cluttering the main traffic areas.

FURNITURE PLACEMENT — FOLLOW EXACTLY:
  • CHAIR_1: Placed at the dining table (table_1) against the left (west) wall.
  • CHAIR_2: Placed at the dining table (table_1) against the left (west) wall, opposite chair_1.
  • BED_1: Centered against the right (east) wall.
  • NIGHTSTAND_1: Positioned against the right (east) wall, at the head of bed_1.
  • NIGHTSTAND_2: Positioned against the right (east) wall, at the foot of bed_1.
  • TABLE_1: Set against the left (west) wall, between the kitchenette area and the sofa.
  • SOFA_1: Placed against the left (west) wall, south of the dining table.
  • ARTWORK_1: Mounted on the left (west) wall, centered above sofa_1.
  • PLANT_1: Placed on top of nightstand_1.
  • LAMP_1: Placed on top of nightstand_2.
  • ARTWORK_2: Mounted on the right (east) wall, beside nightstand_2 and the foot of the bed.
  • RUG_1: Positioned on the floor against the bottom (south) wall, in front of the left window.
  • RUG_2: Positioned on the floor against the bottom (south) wall, in front of the right window.

ZONES:
  • work_zone: The work/dining zone is located along the upper portion of the left (west) wall, utilizing the table and chairs adjacent to the kitchenette.
  • sleep_zone: The sleep zone is consolidated along the entire right (east) wall, featuring the bed flanked by two nightstands.
  • living_zone: The living zone is situated along the lower portion of the left (west) wall, anchored by the sofa. The entire central floor area is left open for a spacious feel.

⚠️ SPACE OPTIMIZED — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: ALL furniture (Bed, Sofa, Table, everything) MUST be pushed flat against walls. Nothing floating.
- CRITICAL: The physical center of the room must be COMPLETELY EMPTY floor space. No furniture, no rugs in the middle.
- Sofa along a long wall, never floating.
- Table/Desk against a wall, preferably near window if available.
- Wide clear walking path from door to all zones.
- NO furniture within 3 feet of the door.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.

DOOR CLEARANCE: The area directly in front of and around the door is kept completely free of furniture, creating an unobstructed entryway and a clear path into the main living space.

STRUCTURAL (fixed): Door=north (top) at ~46%, Window=interior at ~50%, Others=[refrigerator, cabinet, kitchen counter, sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]

OUTPUT: Same 2D style as input, all 13 items in their NEW positions, professional floor plan.
Do NOT place furniture on top of kitchen appliances, bathroom fixtures, or any structural element.
Edit the floor plan to show "Space Optimized".
